alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Crawford; Emmet; Greene; Marshall; Story; Winnebago; Worth (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 8:55PM CST until January 29 at 12:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Light Snow Continues Over the Northern Half of Iowa Tonight, then Bitter Cold Overnight... Light falling snow and areas of blowing snow will linger into the night across the northern half of Iowa with additional accumulations of an inch or less. Cold air will also continue to settle in overnight with wind chills dropping into the teens and 20s below zero. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of an inch or less. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central Iowa. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and snow covered road conditions. Blowing snow could reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Carroll; Crawford; Emmet; Greene; Marshall; Story; Winnebago; Worth
